reviewText:
Product received for free

So we have dreii,

This game is what id call super casual but tons of fun, best played with friends or just randoms if you like, its basiclly a selection of levels that each have a physical puzzle to solve, either solo or with help.

It wont keep you gaming for days on end but it does make puzzle solving that little bit better and gives a great incentive to work as a team, at times it cracks me up i have to say, especially on some of the more difficult stages.

The only downside to this id say is its very short and once you know the puzzles it just becomes too easy, but for what it is its alot of fun in a small package.

Its definately worth a thumbs up and a great little game to try out.

reviewText:
IntroductionI saw this game a while back on YouTube and was greatly interested to try it out. I have been given a key by the publisher/developer and decided to give this game a detailed review because I enjoyed it.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=625132584
Points of interestAs far as I am aware, there isn’t a story behind the game, so it’s up for interpretation.

There are 5 zones, each with 8-10 levels. You can take shortcuts and skip certain levels by following diverging paths. There are 6 different level types, indicated by white circles with varying icons. Beginner levels, gate levels, multiplayer levels, water levels, space levels, and regular levels indicated by a plain white circle.

The goal of each level is to build a structure or assisting framework to reach an indicated point (and stay balanced for 2-3 seconds). As well as level types, there are also different block types. There are blocks that explode, blocks that cannot be picked up, and blocks that are breakable. In order to reach your target, you have to use your avatar to pick up shapes and arrange them in a certain manner. Most of the puzzles are easy and straightforward, but others are much more difficult and some are influenced by various environmental factors.

My favorite part of this game is the multiplayer levels. Indicated by an asterisk (*), multiplayer levels have complicated puzzles that require help from other players to solve. The only way to communicate is by using one word chat messages which you can unlock as you progress. These messages can be translated into 19 different languages, eliminating communication barriers.  By working together you can move heavy objects and make complicated structures that would not be possible if you were working by yourself.

One of the only cons that I can think of is the price tag and content. $12 for a couple hours of gameplay is a lot to ask. Sadly, I can only recommend this game on sale at its current state. If more content is added, the price could be more justified.

There is also a mobile version which is $4 on the apple and android store. According to their website, a PS4, PS vita, and possibly Wii U version will also be released shortly.
SummaryOverall, I am really impressed with what this game had to offer, even if it lacks some content. Some of the strong points are the cross-platform multiplayer, level variety, simplistic puzzles.

My implemented rating system:Run away! 1-2/10
Handle with caution… 3-4/10
Buy on sale: 5-6/10
Every day purchase: 7-8/10Must buy: 9-10/10

This game’s rating: 6.5/10. I want to give it a 7 or 8, but at the current price, I can’t. If you are not worried about the price and just want to have an interesting experience, I recommend this game for you. http://store.steampowered.com/app/298420
Any constructive feedback is appreciated!

reviewText: I was really impressed by how easy it is to pick up and play, and to find people to play with. To drop in / drop out puzzle solving environment is amazing.
